Model

Class DBQuery

  • java.lang.Object
    • Model.DBQuery

  • public class DBQuery
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains static methods that query the company database to return the requested information.

    • Method Detail

      • fetchUserId

        public static int fetchUserId(java.lang.String username,
                              java.lang.String password)
        Queries the company database to see if there is a matching user with the given password. The method will return an int representing the userId value in the database if the username and password combination is found. Else, the method will return a -1.
        Parameters:
        username - a String representing the username value in the database
        password - a String representing the user password value in the database
        Returns:
        an int representing the userId or -1 if not found

      • updateSingleValueInDatabase

        public static boolean updateSingleValueInDatabase(java.lang.String table,
                                                  java.lang.String columnName,
                                                  java.lang.String value,
                                                  java.lang.String primaryKeyColumnName,
                                                  int primaryKeyValue)
        Updates a single string value in one matching record in the database. The record is identified using a WHERE clause in the SQL query, in which the value in the primaryKeyColumnName matches the passed primaryKeyValue.
        Parameters:
        table - - a string representing the name of the table to update
        columnName - - a string representing the name of the column to update
        value - - a string representing the value that is to be placed in the given column
        primaryKeyColumnName - - a string representing the name of the primary key column in the database
        primaryKeyValue - - an int representing the id of the row to be updated
        Returns:
        true if the update was successful, false if the update was unsuccessful

      • updateSingleValueInDatabase

        public static boolean updateSingleValueInDatabase(java.lang.String table,
                                                  java.lang.String columnName,
                                                  int value,
                                                  java.lang.String primaryKeyColumnName,
                                                  int primaryKeyValue)
        Updates a single int value in one matching record in the database. The record is identified using a WHERE clause in the SQL query, in which the value in the primaryKeyColumnName matches the passed primaryKeyValue.
        Parameters:
        table - - a string representing the name of the table to update
        columnName - - a string representing the name of the column to update
        value - - an int representing the value that is to be placed in the given column
        primaryKeyColumnName - - a string representing the name of the primary key column in the database
        primaryKeyValue - - an int representing the id of the row to be updated
        Returns:
        true if the update was successful, false if the update was unsuccessful

      • updateSingleValueInDatabase

        public static boolean updateSingleValueInDatabase(java.lang.String table,
                                                  java.lang.String columnName,
                                                  java.sql.Timestamp value,
                                                  java.lang.String primaryKeyColumnName,
                                                  int primaryKeyValue)
        Updates a single timestamp value in one matching record in the database. The record is identified using a WHERE clause in the SQL query, in which the value in the primaryKeyColumnName matches the passed primaryKeyValue.
        Parameters:
        table - - a string representing the name of the table to update
        columnName - - a string representing the name of the column to update
        value - - a Timestamp object representing the value that is to be placed in the given column
        primaryKeyColumnName - - a string representing the name of the primary key column in the database
        primaryKeyValue - - an int representing the id of the row to be updated
        Returns:
        true if the update was successful, false if the update was unsuccessful

      • recordExistsInDatabase

        public static int recordExistsInDatabase(java.lang.String tableName,
                                         java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> filterData)
        Checks to see if a record exists in the database based on a set of string-to-string pairs where the first string is the column name and the second string is the value expected in that column. The first column of the table being queried should be an int value.
        Parameters:
        tableName - a String representing the name of the table to check
        filterData - a HashMap where the keys are strings representing the names of the column in the database and the values are strings representing the values expected in the column.
        Returns:
        an int representing the value stored in the first column of the table row if it exists in the database, or -1 if the row does not exist.

      • insertRowIntoDatabase

        public static int insertRowIntoDatabase(java.lang.String table,
                                        java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> data,
                                        java.lang.String keyColumn)
        Inserts a row into a database table.
        Parameters:
        table - a String representing the name of the table into which a row will be inserted
        data - a HashMap in which the keys are String objects representing the names of the columns and the values are String objects representing the values to be inserted into those columns.
        keyColumn - the name of the column that is the primary key for the queried table.
        Returns:
        an int representing the value stored in the primary key column after the row has been inserted, or -1 if the insertion fails.

      • deleteFromTable

        public static int deleteFromTable(java.lang.String tableName,
                                  java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> filterData)
        Deletes records from a table in the database by matching records to the filter data that is passed into the method.
        Parameters:
        tableName - a String representing the name of the table from which rows are to be deleted.
        filterData - a HashMap mapping Strings to Objects, where the String represents the name of the column to check and the Object represents the value to match in the given column.
        Returns:
        an int representing the number of rows that were successfully deleted from the table.

      • getResultSetForFilteredOrderedSelectStatement

        public static java.sql.ResultSet getResultSetForFilteredOrderedSelectStatement(java.lang.String[] columnNames,
                                                                               java.lang.String tableName,
                                                                               java.lang.String sqlFilter,
                                                                               java.lang.String orderByColumnName)
        Allows the user to query a database table and retrieve a set of rows, ordered in ascending order by a chosen column name and filtered by the passed sql-formatted string.
        Parameters:
        columnNames - an array of String objects representing the names of columns to be returned
        tableName - a String representing the name of the table to be queried
        sqlFilter - a String representing an sql formatted filter to be applied to the query
        orderByColumnName - a String representing the name column to use to order the results
        Returns:
        the ResultSet from the executed query statement, or null if there is an error in the sql statement.

      • getResultSetForOrderedSelectStatement

        public static java.sql.ResultSet getResultSetForOrderedSelectStatement(java.lang.String[] columnNames,
                                                                       java.lang.String tableName,
                                                                       java.lang.String orderByColumnName)
        Allows the user to query a database table and retrieve a set of rows, ordered in ascending order by a chosen column name.
        Parameters:
        columnNames - an array of String objects representing the names of columns to be returned
        tableName - a String representing the name of the table to be queried
        orderByColumnName - a String representing the name column to use to order the results
        Returns:
        the ResultSet from the executed query statement

      • getHashMapFromResultSetRow

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getHashMapFromResultSetRow(java.sql.ResultSet rs)
        Creates and returns a HashMap from the rows in the given ResultSet. The HashMap is mapped from String instances, representing the column name, to Object instances, representing the value in the column. The Object instance types are identified by examining the metadata for each column-value set in the ResultSet.
        Parameters:
        rs - the ResultSet with data to be formatted into a HashMap
        Returns:
        a HashMap representing the data in the ResultSet

      • executeStatementFromQuery

        public static java.sql.ResultSet executeStatementFromQuery(java.lang.String query)
                                                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        Allows a user to execute a custom query statement.
        Parameters:
        query - a String representing the query to be executed.
        Returns:
        the ResultSet containing the results of the query.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
